intro: Slackia, commonly known as the "slack" or "slack plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Slackia species are known for their delicate, often yellow or white flowers that bloom in the spring. These plants play an important role in supporting local pollinator populations.
